description.zh-cn: 早期基督教最具影响力的传教士和第一代领导人之一，被誉为‘外邦人的使徒’。他原名扫罗，曾是法利赛人并迫害基督徒，后在前往大马士革途中归信基督。他撰写了《新约圣经》中大部分书信，对基督教神学发展影响深远。
description.en: One of the most influential missionaries and first-generation leaders of early Christianity, known as the 'Apostle to the Gentiles'. Originally named Saul, he was a Pharisee who persecuted Christians before converting to Christ on the road to Damascus. He authored a significant portion of the New Testament epistles, profoundly influencing Christian theology.

description.zh-cn: 基督教的中心人物，保罗宣称直接从他获得启示并为其传播福音。
description.en: The central figure of Christianity, from whom Paul claimed to have received his revelation and for whom he spread the gospel.

description.zh-cn: 指从耶稣事工开始到公元325年第一次尼西亚公会议之间的基督教历史时期。保罗是此时期最关键的传教士和神学家。
description.en: Refers to the period of Christian history from the ministry of Jesus to the First Council of Nicaea in 325 AD. Paul was the most crucial missionary and theologian of this period.

description.zh-cn: 古犹太教的一个派别，强调严格遵守律法。保罗在归信基督前曾是其中一员。
description.en: A faction of ancient Judaism that emphasized strict observance of the law. Paul was a member before his conversion to Christianity.

description.zh-cn: 大马士革的基督徒，受主差遣治愈了保罗的眼盲并为他施洗。
description.en: A Christian disciple at Damascus who was sent by the Lord to restore Paul's sight and baptize him.

description.zh-cn: 著名的犹太律法教师，保罗曾在他门下学习。
description.en: A renowned Jewish law teacher under whom Paul studied.

description.zh-cn: 罗马帝国奇里乞亚省的城市，保罗的出生地。
description.en: A city in the Roman province of Cilicia, and the birthplace of Paul.

description.zh-cn: 古代罗马文明的一个阶段，保罗在此帝国境内出生、传教并殉道。
description.en: A phase of ancient Roman civilization, within which Paul was born, conducted his ministry, and was martyred.

description.zh-cn: 以色列十二支派之一，保罗出身于此支派。
description.en: One of the Twelve Tribes of Israel, from which Paul descended.

description.zh-cn: 耶稣十二使徒之一，早期教会的领袖，曾与雅各一同接纳保罗。
description.en: One of the Twelve Apostles of Jesus and a leader of the early Church, who, along with James, accepted Paul.

description.zh-cn: 耶稣的兄弟，耶路撒冷教会的领袖，曾与彼得一同接纳保罗。
description.en: Brother of Jesus and a leader of the Jerusalem church, who, along with Peter, accepted Paul.

description.zh-cn: 早期基督徒，保罗初期的传教伙伴，后因约翰·马可之事与保罗分离。
description.en: An early Christian and Paul's initial missionary partner, who later separated from Paul over a dispute concerning John Mark.

description.zh-cn: 罗马皇帝，传统上认为他在位期间下令处死了使徒保罗。
description.en: Roman Emperor during whose reign, according to tradition, the Apostle Paul was executed.

description.zh-cn: 罗马帝国的首都，保罗在此被囚禁并最终殉道。
description.en: The capital of the Roman Empire, where Paul was imprisoned and ultimately martyred.

description.zh-cn: 古代基督教五大宗主教区之一，传统上认为保罗是其首位主教。
description.en: One of the five major patriarchates of ancient Christianity, which traditionally regards Paul as its first bishop.

description.zh-cn: 新约圣经中由使徒保罗写给各个早期基督教会或个人的信件的统称。
description.en: The collection of letters in the New Testament written by the Apostle Paul to various early Christian communities or individuals.

description.zh-cn: 基督教的经典文献，其中约三分之一的内容由保罗撰写。
description.en: The canonical scriptures of Christianity, approximately one-third of which was authored by Paul.

description.zh-cn: 巴拿巴的同伴，因其在第一次传教旅行中途离开，成为保罗与巴拿巴争论和分离的原因。
description.en: A companion of Barnabas, whose departure during the first missionary journey became the cause of the dispute and separation between Paul and Barnabas.

description.zh-cn: 塞浦路斯的一位法术师，因试图阻止保罗传教而被其暂时弄瞎。
description.en: A sorcerer in Cyprus who was temporarily blinded by Paul for opposing his preaching.

description.zh-cn: 罗马皇帝，使基督教合法化。他在保罗的殉道地修建了城外圣保禄大殿。
description.en: Roman emperor who legalized Christianity. He built the Basilica of Saint Paul Outside the Walls at the site of Paul's martyrdom.

en: Basilica of Saint Paul Outside the Walls

description.zh-cn: 位于罗马的一座天主教宗座圣殿，据信是为纪念使徒保罗殉道而建，并存放其骸骨。
description.en: A papal major basilica in Rome, believed to be built over the burial place of Saint Paul and to house his remains.

description.zh-cn: 一部中世纪反基督教的犹太文献，其中将保罗描绘为耶稣的反对者。
description.en: A medieval anti-Christian Jewish text which portrays Paul as an antagonist to Jesus.

description.zh-cn: 保罗出生于罗马帝国奇里乞亚省的大数城。
description.en: Paul was born in the city of Tarsus in the Roman province of Cilicia.

description.zh-cn: 保罗生来就拥有罗马公民权。
description.en: Paul was a Roman citizen by birth.

description.zh-cn: 保罗出身于以色列的便雅悯支派。
description.en: Paul was from the Israelite tribe of Benjamin.

description.zh-cn: 在归信基督之前，保罗是一名法利赛人，热衷于犹太律法。
description.en: Before his conversion to Christianity, Paul was a Pharisee, zealous for the Jewish law.

description.zh-cn: 保罗曾在耶路撒冷于著名的律法教师迦玛列门下学习。
description.en: Paul studied in Jerusalem under the renowned law teacher Gamaliel.

description.zh-cn: 在归信之前，保罗（时名扫罗）认为基督教是异端，并极力迫害基督徒。
description.en: Before his conversion, Paul (then named Saul) considered Christianity a heresy and actively persecuted Christians.

description.zh-cn: 在前往大马士革的路上，复活的耶稣向保罗显现并对他说话，直接导致了他的归信。
description.en: On the road to Damascus, the resurrected Jesus appeared and spoke to Paul, directly leading to his conversion.

description.zh-cn: 亚拿尼亚奉主差遣，按手在保罗身上，使其恢复视力，并为他施洗。
description.en: Ananias, sent by the Lord, laid hands on Paul, restoring his sight and baptizing him.

description.zh-cn: 归信后，保罗成为基督教最主要的传教者之一，通过多次传教旅行，将福音传播到地中海各地，建立了许多教会。
description.en: After his conversion, Paul became one of Christianity's foremost missionaries, spreading the gospel throughout the Mediterranean world and establishing numerous churches through several missionary journeys.

description.zh-cn: 作为早期教会的领袖，彼得接纳并支持了归信后的保罗。
description.en: As a leader of the early church, Peter accepted and supported Paul after his conversion.

description.zh-cn: 作为耶路撒冷教会的柱石，雅各接纳并支持了归信后的保罗。
description.en: As a pillar of the Jerusalem church, James accepted and supported Paul after his conversion.

description.zh-cn: 巴拿巴到大数城邀请保罗协助安提阿的圣工，开启了他们最初的合作。
description.en: Barnabas went to Tarsus to invite Paul to assist with the ministry in Antioch, initiating their early collaboration.

description.zh-cn: 在第二次传教旅行前，保罗因是否带上约翰·马可的问题与巴拿巴发生激烈争论，导致两人分道扬镳。
description.en: Before the second missionary journey, Paul had a sharp disagreement with Barnabas over whether to take John Mark, which led to their separation.

description.zh-cn: 因约翰·马可曾在第一次传教旅行中途离开，保罗坚决反对在第二次旅行中带上他。
description.en: Because John Mark had deserted them on the first missionary journey, Paul strongly opposed taking him on the second journey.

description.zh-cn: 保罗撰写了多封书信，这些书信后来被收录于《新约圣经》中。
description.en: Paul authored numerous epistles, which were later included in the New Testament.

description.zh-cn: 保罗书信是构成新约圣经的重要组成部分。
description.en: The Pauline epistles are a major component of the New Testament.

description.zh-cn: 教会传统追认保罗为第一位安提约基雅主教。
description.en: Church tradition recognizes Paul as the first Bishop of Antioch.

description.zh-cn: 根据基督教传统，罗马皇帝尼禄在位时下令将保罗斩首，使其殉道。
description.en: According to Christian tradition, Emperor Nero ordered the beheading of Paul, leading to his martyrdom.

description.zh-cn: 在塞浦路斯传教时，保罗斥责并暂时使法术师以吕马眼盲，因为后者试图阻挠总督信教。
description.en: While preaching in Cyprus, Paul rebuked and temporarily blinded the sorcerer Elymas, who was trying to prevent the proconsul from believing.

description.zh-cn: 君士坦丁大帝在保罗的殉道地修建了最初的圣殿，即后来的城外圣保禄大殿。
description.en: Constantine the Great built the original basilica, which became the Basilica of Saint Paul Outside the Walls, at the site of Paul's martyrdom.

description.zh-cn: 城外圣保禄大殿是为了纪念保罗而建，并据信存放着他的骸骨。
description.en: The Basilica of Saint Paul Outside the Walls was built in memory of Paul and is believed to house his remains.

description.zh-cn: 中世纪反基督教犹太文献《耶稣一生》将保罗（以利亚的扫罗）描绘成与耶稣对抗的反对者。
description.en: The medieval anti-Christian Jewish text 'Toledot Yeshu' portrays Paul (Shaul Eliyahu) as an antagonist who worked against Jesus.
